thread.title: Patrick 'Patsy' Adams and wife charged with attempted murder
thread.title_full: Patrick 'Patsy' Adams and wife charged with attempted murder - Telegraph

author: Martin Evans , Crime Correspondent
title: Patrick 'Patsy' Adams and wife charged with attempted murder
text: A married couple have been charged with attempted murder over a shooting which took place in London in December 2013. Patrick Adams and his wife Constance having been extradited from Holland where they were arrested in August this year. Mr Adams, 59, who is known as Patsy, is the younger brother of feared underworld crime boss, Terry Adams. An appeal by Scotland Yard to locate the couple was issued earlier this year in relation to a shooting which took place in broad daylight in Clerkenwell, central London. Patsy Adams in his younger days Photo: Photonews Service The shooting took place three days before Christmas on December 22 at 10 o’clock in the morning, when a man and woman approached a motorist who was sitting at the wheel of his black BMW X5 car and shot him in the chest. Witnesses described how the 51-year-old victim staggered from his car, which had been stationery at the junction of St John Street and Wycliff Street, close to City University, clutching his chest and screaming for help. The victim survived the attack, but spent more than a month in hospital recovering from his injuries. Police said they believed Mr and Mrs Adams had left the country shortly after the shooting and efforts to trace them proved fruitless, although they were rumoured to be in Spain or the Netherlands. Mr Adams was one of 11 children brought up in a working class Irish Catholic family in the Barnsbury area of Islington, close to where Tony Blair and his wife Cherie made their home before moving into Downing Street. In 2007 Terry was jailed for seven years after admitting a single specimen charge of money laundering . Terry Adams was jailed in 2007 He was released from prison three years later, but was subsequently recalled to jail for breaching the terms of his licence. Last year a judge ordered him to hand over £650,000 proceeds of crime, after Mr Adams failed to convince the court he had spent all his money. A Scotland Yard spokesman said: “ A husband and wife have been charged following their extradition from the Netherlands in relation to a shooting that took place in St John Street, EC1 in December 2013. “Patrick Adams, 59, and Constance Adams, 55, were charged on Thursday, 22 October, with attempted murder and possession of a firearm with intent to endanger life.” The couple will appear before Westminster Magistrates' Court. telegraph.co.uk Follow @telegraphnews
